column4: Could Someone help me with installing my Graphic Card Driver in Ubunut?
okay.
How did you try to install it?
Any errors in particular?
Can you paste the output of /var/log/s3setup.log and /var/log/s3build.log ?
Well that's odd, as it says to refer to both of those at the end of the log...
Are you running the install with X server shut down?
This might help: http://drivers.s3graphics.com/en/download/drivers/chrome_PCIe-Linux/Readme
In the console: sudo /etc/init.d/Xdm stop
That will kill all graphical applications though, including your IRC client if you are using a graphical one...
Okay, but to get to a console after killing X type: CTRL+ALT+F1
sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop
or kdm stop, depending on which one you are using.
As HardyOne pointed out, you can type sudo /etc/init.d/?dm stop
hello.
It should kill X...
Yes.
If you had a working configuration, it's possible that that is the best it's going to get. Changing the drivers will not significantly affect performance unless the drivers are notably poor.
Perhaps what you really want is a better graphics card?
Well do you have the driver properly installed?
If the included driver has 3D acceleration, then maybe you just don't have it configured properly.
The vesa driver is probably not the driver you are supposed to be using with your graphics card. Other people have said there is a driver for your card included in Ubuntu... Did you look into that?
I think that route is probably a better bet than recompiling the drivers yourself... Maybe you should try fixing that instead of compiling drivers?
